    • Method Detail

      • getVoltage

        public float getVoltage()
                 throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                        ConnectionLostException
        Description copied from interface: AnalogInput
        Gets the analog input reading, as an absolute voltage in Volt units.

        It typically takes a few milliseconds between when the instance is created and until the first value can be read. In this case, the method may block shortly. If this is a problem, the calling thread can be interrupted.

        If a scaled value is desired, consider using AnalogInput.read().

        Specified by:
        getVoltage in interface AnalogInput
        Returns:
        The voltage, in Volt units.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - The calling thread has been interrupted.
        ConnectionLostException - The connection with the IOIO is lost.
        See Also:
        AnalogInput.read()

      • getReference

        public float getReference()
        Description copied from interface: AnalogInput
        Gets the maximum value against which AnalogInput.read() values are scaled.
        Specified by:
        getReference in interface AnalogInput
        Returns:
        The voltage, in Volts.

      • read

        public float read()
           throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                  ConnectionLostException
        Description copied from interface: AnalogInput
        Gets the analog input reading, as a scaled real value between 0 and 1.

        It typically takes a few milliseconds between when the instance is created and until the first value can be read. In this case, the method may block shortly. If this is a problem, the calling thread can be interrupted.

        If an absolute value is desired, consider using AnalogInput.getVoltage().

        Specified by:
        read in interface AnalogInput
        Returns:
        The voltage, in scaled units.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - The calling thread has been interrupted.
        ConnectionLostException - The connection with the IOIO is lost.
        See Also:
        AnalogInput.getVoltage()

      • disconnected

        public void disconnected()
        Specified by:

      • close

        public void close()
        Specified by:
        close in interface Closeable
        Overrides:
        close in class AbstractPin

      • setBuffer

        public void setBuffer(int capacity)
               throws ConnectionLostException
        Description copied from interface: AnalogInput
        Initializes or destroys an internal buffer, used for queuing sampled data. When called with a positive argument, an internal buffer will be created, and start storing sampled data. The client can then call AnalogInput.readBuffered() or AnalogInput.getVoltageBuffered() for obtaining buffered samples.

        When called with argument of 0, the internal buffer is destroyed.

        Specified by:
        setBuffer in interface AnalogInput
        Parameters:
        capacity - The maximum number of unread samples that can be buffered before overflow occurs.
        Throws:
        ConnectionLostException - The connection with the IOIO is lost.

      • readBuffered

        public float readBuffered()
                   throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                          ConnectionLostException
        Description copied from interface: AnalogInput
        Read a sample from the internal buffer. This method will block until at least one sample is available, the instance is closed (via Closeable.close()), the thread is interrupted (via Thread.interrupt() or connection is lost. AnalogInput.setBuffer(int) must be called prior to this method for setting up an internal buffer for storing samples.
        Specified by:
        readBuffered in interface AnalogInput
        Returns:
        The earliest (oldest) sample available in the buffer, scaled to the range [0,1].
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - The calling thread has been interrupted.
        ConnectionLostException - The connection with the IOIO is lost.
        See Also:
        AnalogInput.getVoltageBuffered()

      • getVoltageBuffered

        public float getVoltageBuffered()
                         throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                                ConnectionLostException
        Description copied from interface: AnalogInput
        Read a sample from the internal buffer. This method will block until at least one sample is available, the instance is closed (via Closeable.close()), the thread is interrupted (via Thread.interrupt() or connection is lost. AnalogInput.setBuffer(int) must be called prior to this method for setting up an internal buffer for storing samples.
        Specified by:
        getVoltageBuffered in interface AnalogInput
        Returns:
        The earliest (oldest) sample available in the buffer, in Volt units.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - The calling thread has been interrupted.
        ConnectionLostException - The connection with the IOIO is lost.
        See Also:
        AnalogInput.readBuffered()

      • available

        public int available()
              throws ConnectionLostException
        Description copied from interface: AnalogInput
        Gets the number of samples currently in the buffer. Reading that many samples is guaranteed not to block.
        Specified by:
        available in interface AnalogInput
        Returns:
        The number of samples available in the buffer.
        Throws:
        ConnectionLostException - The connection with the IOIO is lost.
